page.title: 16Tourism-Regatta and Museum.
page.content: The{Regatta,}which has been going for 5 years, is held during a weekend early in July. River events include raft, rowing, canoe-ing, swimming and sailing races, and trips from Everson point to the Melton area(approx. 1m.). On shore are attractions such as a marching band, tug-of-war, pillow fights,and stalls. The{Museum}was started in 1982 with money bequeathed by local lady Ruth Haywood.It is run by volunteers and opened to the public from April to October. In one room there are some photos of the nearby{Sutton Hoo {burial}.(the real treasure is in the {British Museum}).Admission charges in 1985 are: adults 30p and children under fourteen get in free. The{Shire Hall,}on market hill is well worth a visit also . (see page 8.)
